articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Holds Talks with Gabon's President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Holds Talks with Gabon's President
Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Talks between Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Ali Bongo Ondimba, President of Gabon, were held at the Gabonese presidential office on Tuesday.
					 Ali Bongo Ondimba said that it is the stand of the Gabonese government to steadily develop the friendly relations with the DPRK. Gabon will always support the cause of achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea, he declared.
					
					 He wished the Korean people great success in their efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful nation and improve the people's standard of living.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the matter of consolidating the friendly ties between the two countries and further developing the bilateral relations and on issues of mutual concern.
					
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and Ri Myong Chol, DPRK ambassador to Gabon, and from the opposite side were Paul Biyoghe Mba, prime minister of Gabon, Paul Toungui, minister of Foreign Affairs, International Cooperation and Francophone, Alphonsine Mbie Nna, minister of Public Health, Social Affairs and Family, Magloire Ngambia, minister of Economy, Trade, Industry and Tourism, and Emmanuel Allo, Gabonese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: DPRK, Gabon Sign Cultural Cooperation Agreement
articles.content:
DPRK, Gabon Sign Cultural Cooperation Agreement 
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cultural cooperation between governments of the DPRK and Gabon and a protocol of cooperation between the DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Gabonese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, International Cooperation and Francophone were signed in Libreville on Tuesday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and Ri Myong Chol, DPRK ambassador to Gabon.
					
					 Present from the opposite side were Ali Bongo Ondimba, president of Gabon, Paul Biyoghe Mba, prime minister, Paul Toungui, minister of Foreign Affairs, International Cooperation and Francophone, Alphonsine Mbie Nna, minister for Public Health, Social Affairs and Family, Magloire Ngambia, minister of Economy, Trade, Industry and Tourism, and Emmanuel Allo, Gabonese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 The agreement and protocol were signed by Kim Hyong Jun and Paul Toungui.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Thanks to Gabon's President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Thanks to Gabon's President 
Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of thanks to Ali Bongo Ondimba, President of Gabon, upon leaving Libreville after winding up his official goodwill visit to the Republic of Gabon.
					 Kim in the message expressed profound thanks to the president and the government of Gabon and its people for the warm welcome and cordial hospitality accorded to him and his party.
					
					 The message referred to the fact that at a series of talks and conversations he exchanged with the Gabonese side sincere views on the issue of steadily and energetically boosting the bilateral relations and on matters of mutual concern.
					
					 It expressed satisfaction over the fact that the visit that took place under the deep care of the president and the government of Gabon provided an important occasion in deepening the mutual understanding and friendship and further promoting the development of the bilateral relations.
					
					I was deeply impressed to see for myself the good successes made by the Gabonese people in their work for the prosperity of the country, the message noted, sincerely wishing the friendly Gabonese people fresh progress and well-being and the President good health and greater success in his work.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Leaves Libreville
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves Libreville 
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday left Libreville after winding up his official goodwill visit to the Republic of Gabon.
					 Leaving together with him were Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and other suite members.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam and his party were seen off by Paul Biyoghe Mba, prime minister of Gabon, Paul Toungui, minister of Foreign Affairs, International Cooperation and Francophone, Angelique Ngoma, minister of Defence, Jean Francois Ndongou, minister of Interior, Social Security, Emigration and Decentralization, Emmanuel Allo, Gabonese ambassador to the DPRK, and other persons concerned and Ri Myong Chol, DPRK ambassador to Gabon.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets New Namibian FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets New Namibian FM
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message to Utoni Nujoma Tuesday on his appointment as foreign minister of Namibia.
					 Expressing belief that the excellent relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to strengthen and develop, the message wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Chinese Official on China-DPRK Friendship
articles.content:
Chinese Official on China-DPRK Friendship
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Xu Caihou, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party and vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, met and had a talk with the delegation of officials in charge of foreign affairs of the Korean People's Army led by Major General An Yong Gi at the August 1 Building in Beijing on Tuesday.
					 Xu said that the Chinese people and army set store by the traditional China-DPRK friendship provided by the revolutionaries of the elder generation of the two countries.
					
					 He noted that the two countries have made great contribution to defending the regional peace and stability, supporting and closely cooperating with each other over the past years.
					
					 Invariable is the stand of the Chinese party and government to steadily consolidate and develop the China-DPRK friendship no matter how the international situation may change, he declared.
					
					 The armies of China and the DPRK are assuming the important mission and responsibility for the development of the China-DPRK friendly relations, he said, stressing that the two countries would further develop their militant friendship sealed in blood this year marking the 60th anniversary of the Chinese People's Volunteers' entry into the Korean front.
					
					 Present on the occasion were Ma Xiaotian, deputy chief of the General Staff of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Qian Lihua, director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Ministry of National Defence, and Ambassador Choe Jin Su and the military attache of the DPRK embassy in Beijing.

articles.title: Gifts from Kuwaiti Zoo
articles.content:
Gifts from Kuwaiti Zoo
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received rare animals from the Kuwaiti Zoo as gifts.
					 The gifts are 22 animals of six kinds including African Lion, Camelus bromedarius, Barbary sheep and Hamadryas Baboon.
					
					 The zoo sent 60 animals of nine kinds including black swan and rose-ringed parakeet in Juche 97 (2008).
					
					 The animals have settled down in the Central Zoo.

articles.title: Meeting of Scientists and Technicians Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Scientists and Technicians Held
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- A national meeting of scientists and technicians in the era of Songun was held at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.
					 Attending the meeting were senior officials including Kim Yong Il, Jon Pyong Ho and Choe Thae Bok, others and leading officials of party organs and administrative and economic bodies and officials of institutions, enterprises and farms in provinces, cities and counties, exemplary scientists and technicians and a delegation of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.
					
					 Prior to the meeting, its participants heard the recorded speech "The Duty of Scientists and Technicians in Carrying Out the Technical Revolution" made by President Kim Il Sung at the meeting of scientists and technicians held on March 22, Juche 52 (1963).
					
					Vice-Premier O Su Yong in his report at the meeting said that General Secretary Kim Jong Il set forth the line of attaching importance to science and technology as a strategic line for building a thriving socialist nation and has wisely led the drive for its implementation.
					
					 Kim Jong Il published the work "On Thoroughly Implementing the Party's Line of Attaching Importance to Science and Technology," clearly indicating an orientation and ways for rapidly developing the nation's science and technology, the reporter noted, adding: He not only made the traits of attaching importance to science and technology prevail throughout the country but also firmly built strong scientific and technical forces and laid a solid material foundation.
					
					 The reporter referred to the great changes brought about in the field of science and technology, pointing out that under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the DPRK firmly held the supremacy of CNC technology and kicked off the vigorous drive to seize an unchallenged edge in everything by pushing back the frontiers of science and technology as required by the IT age.
					
					 He underlined the need for all the scientists and technicians to make a positive contribution to the development of the nation's science and technology by exploring cutting-edge technology as required by the age of knowledge-based economy and leaping higher and faster.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting said that they would successfully solve the scientific and technological problems arising in improving the people's standard of living and developing the overall national economy and put the nation's science and technology on a higher level as required by the age of knowledge-based economy and thus make a positive contribution to fully demonstrating the might of Songun Korea.
					
					 An appeal to all the scientists and technicians of the DPRK was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 The appeal underlined the need for the scientists and technicians to contribute to solving the problems of food, clothing and housing with great scientific and technological achievements.
					
					 It also called for turning the nation's economy into an economy based on CNC and an intensively developed scientific and technological one based on high science and technology so that the independent national economy in the DPRK may have strong competitive power in every aspect in the world and hold worldwide supremacy in all fields.

articles.title: Scientific Research Prize Awarded to Students
articles.content:
Scientific Research Prize Awarded to Students 
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- The University Student Scientific Research Prize was awarded to more than 700 exemplary students in the DPRK.
					 Those students have distinguished themselves in study for attaining up-to-the-minute scientific and technological knowledge and in scientific research and made positive contribution to solving the technical problems arising in production while being active at worksites seething with the drive for great surge.
					
					 Its awarding ceremony took place at the hall of the youth league on Tuesday.

articles.title: Kiwi Fruit Trees Propagated
articles.content:
Kiwi Fruit Trees Propagated 
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- A brisk campaign for propagating kiwi fruit trees (Actinidia deliciosa) with a high edible and medicinal value has been under way in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 A research team of the Central Botanical Garden has studied the physiological characteristics of the tree in a scientific way and founded out a rational open-air grafting method to easily multiply it in any place of the country.
					
					 The method has already been applied to various parts of the country and recently even to Kanggye City, Jagang Province and other northern inlands with low temperature and unfavorable conditions of growth.
					
					 It ensures a high rate of rooting and a good harvest of fruits.

articles.title: Medical Apparatuses Using Kumjin Stone Developed
articles.content:
Medical Apparatuses Using Kumjin Stone Developed
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- The Sambong Technical Exchange Company of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has made medical apparatuses with Kumjin stone.
					 They, based on nanotechnology and physicochemical properties of pearl and scores of rare metals including silver, are available for different diseases.
					
					 They raise the physiological activity and function of internal organs to the maximum and give strong sterilizing, antiphlogistic and sedative effects by using electromagnetic waves of different bands, far infrared rays, radiation and elemental oxygen.
					
					 They are of sovereign remedy for arrhythmia, vertebral neuralgia,
					
					female disorders, liver trouble (early stage of liver cirrhosis, cholecystitis and inflammation of bile duct), indigestion and cacostomia (toothache, pyorrhea alveolaris, sore throat and laryngitis), as well as prostatitis and sexual dysfunction.
					
					 The portable appliances are long in serviceable life.

articles.title: Scientist of Dignity in Applied Chemistry
articles.content:
Scientist of Dignity in Applied Chemistry
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- A new kind of lead-acid battery for safety lamp has been developed by Dr. Choe Mun Il, a section chief of the Catalyst Research Institute of Kim Il Sung University, and introduced into coal mines in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, well received by the users for its small size, good efficiency and long discharging time.
					 He, crowned with the title of Merited Scientist, has developed various kinds of batteries such as a lithium battery and an engine-starting battery, winning prestige in the applied chemistry sector.
					
					 He, who started his career as a scientist early in the 1980s, has made a contribution to putting the national economy on a modern basis with scores of valuable inventions, including a chemiluminescence analyzer.
					
					 In particular a nanocarbonic dispersion solution, an additive for lead-acid battery, and an oxygen concentration measuring instrument are of great significance in the industrial development and preservation of historic relics.
					
					 He has brought up tens of awardees of academic degrees or titles and written lots of books and scientific papers conducive to education over the nearly three decades.

articles.title: US Imperialists' Germ Warfare during Korean War Slammed
articles.content:
US Imperialists' Germ Warfare during Korean War Slammed
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Media of different countries of the world are giving wide coverage to the recent disclosure of new evidence proving that the U.S. imperialists waged the germ warfare during the last Korean war.
					 According to them, in September 1951 the then chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff issued an order to "start a large-scale field experiment to examine the effect of special microorganism during the operation".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard: 
					
					 This is historical evidence laying bare the cruel and brutal nature of the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					 The commentary cites facts to prove that the U.S. imperialists adopted the germ warfare as one of the basic means of war and indiscriminately perpetrated it against the peaceable inhabitants. 
					
					 They developed germ weapons to kill more innocent people and unhesitatingly used these weapons against them during the war. This was the thrice-cursed atrocity which could be committed only by the U.S. imperialists, the brutes in human shape and with inborn wolfish nature, the commentary says, and goes on: 
					
					 The U.S. has committed the worst massacres and human rights abuses but is loudmouthed about "humanitarianism" and "respect for human rights," thus deceiving and making a mockery of human consciousness.
					
					  Shortly ago, the U.S. in "its country reports on human rights practices for 2009" took issue with "the human rights record" of this country or that one. 
					
					 The U.S. is behaving as if it were "an international human rights judge", impudently advocating the "defense of human rights" even at the U.N. forum. 
					
					 No matter what sleight of hand the U.S. may employ, shamelessly disguising itself as "a champion of human rights", this will get it nowhere. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to honestly admit the germ warfare waged against the Korean people during the last Korean war and redeem its crime.

articles.title: Resolute Actions against Aggressors Called for
articles.content:
Resolute Actions against Aggressors Called for
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Neither independence and democracy nor national reunification are achievable without a resolute struggle against the oppressors, observes Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed article.
					 The Korean nation has undergone the misery and agony resulting from its split and failed to realize its desire for national independence and prosperity due to the U.S. imperialists' occupation of south Korea, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is still lording it over south Korea, exercising real power in all fields including politics, economy, culture and military affairs after occupying it by force of arms. The pro-U.S. conservative forces are the last forces in south Korea on which the U.S. depends.
					
					 The south Korean ruling quarters are fascistizing the society in a bid to stay in power and enjoy wealth and prosperity, backed by outside forces. The U.S. imperialists are egging the south Korean bellicose forces on to stage madcap nuclear war exercises for invading the DPRK, blatantly challenging the desire of the south Korean people for independence and democracy.
					
					 If foreign aggressors and the south Korean bellicose forces are allowed to go on with the above-said moves, they will put the destiny of the Korean nation at peril. This is contrary both to the trend of the present era when countries and nations are heading for independence, peace and prosperity and to the need of the June 15 era of reunification to demonstrate the dignity of the nation with the might of national independence and unity.
					
					 Outside forces and traitors never present independence, democracy and national reunification to the south Korean people as they seek their own interests only.
					
					 Solidarity and alliance among the people from all walks of life constitute a decisive factor of a victory in their struggle.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday dedicates a signed article to the 28th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On the Juche Idea".
					 The work comprehensively deals with the Juche idea fathered by President Kim Il Sung in a systematic and integral way. It clarifies all issues ranging from the founding of the Juche idea to its philosophical principle, socio-historical principle, guiding principle and its historic significance.
					
					 The past 28 years witnessed the striking demonstration of the truth and tremendous vitality of the Juche idea under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Juche idea has served as an ideological and moral source of strength to consolidate the single-minded unity of all the servicepersons and people and dynamically push forward the advance for effecting a great surge. It has, at the same time, served as guidelines for encouraging them to make a breakthrough toward the prosperity of the country in the strong spirit of national independence and a treasured sword of the revolution for foiling the imperialists' ideological and cultural poisoning and reliably defending the banner of socialism.
					
					 The stirring reality today when all the servicepersons and people are out in the drive for a new great revolutionary surge and bringing about great innovations and a great leap forward to materialize Kim Jong Il's idea of effecting a great surge and his far-reaching plan clearly shows what high level the might of the single-minded unity of the Korean revolution has reached.
					
					 All the servicepersons and people are united close around the leader in thinking and purpose. This single-minded unity represents an admirable picture which can be seen only in the society of the DPRK guided by the Juche idea, the Songun idea.
					
					 It is the fixed will of the Workers' Party of Korea and the unanimous wishes of the Korean people to build an invincible thriving socialist nation on this land by their own efforts and their own way.
					
					 All the people form an integral whole with the leader and a big harmonious family under socialism and live and struggle full of confidence and optimism about the future while helping and leading each other forward. This is the intrinsic nature of socialism and herein lies the invincibility of Korean-style socialism.
					
					 The present stirring reality clearly testifies to the truth that the Juche idea is an eternal militant banner for the army and people of the DPRK and nothing can bar them from advancing under the banner of the idea, concludes the article.

articles.title: KCTU Declares All-out Struggle
articles.content:
KCTU Declares All-out Struggle 
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held a rally in Youido of Seoul on March 27 with the attendance of at least 10,000 unionists at which it declared an all-out struggle against the unpopular policies of the puppet regime. 
					 At the rally the speakers accused the authorities of dismissing workers en masse, imposing low wages upon laborers and intensifying the suppression of trade unions including the Railway Workers' Union, the Construction Workers' Union, the Government Employees' Union and the Teachers' Trade Union. 
					
					 There is neither people's hope nor future for children, if we hesitate to struggle in face of the present dark reality, they held, calling upon the people from all walks of life to unite and surely judge the "government" going against the mindset of the people.
					
					 A resolution read out at the rally noted that the organization would launch strong actions including a general strike at the end of April to check the massive dismissal through restructuring, put an end to the unpopular policies and win the right to existence.
					
					 The organization would solidarize with all the anti-"government" forces, in particular, in order to turn the "elections to the local self-governing bodies" into a platform for judging the present regime and win a sure victory, declared the resolution.

articles.title: S. Korea Puppet Accused of Blocking Resumption of Tour
articles.content:
S. Korea Puppet Accused of Blocking Resumption of Tour
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Organizations of south Korea including the Solidarity for Progress, the Confederation of Trade Unions, the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the Youth Solidarity and the Federation of University Students in the 21st Century at a meeting held in Seoul on March 27 demanded the resignation of the puppet minister of Unification standing in the way of resuming the tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					 Speakers at the meeting denounced the conservative group including the minister of "Unification" for blocking the resumption of the above-said tour, insisting on what it called "three conditions".
					
					 They deplored that the confrontation policy of the present "government" has not only brought direct economic losses to south Korea but beclouded even the prospect of peaceful reunification and common prosperity.
					
					 The tour of Mt. Kumgang paves the way for the Koreans to live together and achieve peaceful reunification, they said, urging the authorities to come out for the negotiations for the resumption of the tour as early as possible.

articles.title: Juche Idea Study Organization Formed in France
articles.content:
Juche Idea Study Organization Formed in France
						
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- The French Intellectuals' Study Association for Independent Development was inaugurated with due ceremony in Paris on Mar. 24.
					 Present there were figures of academic circles in France.
					
					 At the ceremony Edmond Jouve, honorary professor of University of Paris 5 and director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the association.
					
					 The chairman said that anyone, if he or she hopes to find a true path to the independent development of mankind at present, should make a deep study of the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and developed in depth by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the ceremony.

articles.title: Magazine "Paektu-Halla" Issued in China
articles.content:
Magazine "Paektu-Halla" Issued in China
 Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China published the March issue of its magazine "Paektu-Halla".
					 The magazine carried a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il receiving a bunch of flowers from a child.
					
					 Edited in it was photo-illustrated news about colorful events held by the association and its affiliated organizations to celebrate his birthday.
					
					 Under captions "The pluck of the great leader General Kim Jong Il" and "Korea-leader and women's movement" the magazine carried articles praising the personality of Kim Jong Il as a great man and his undying revolutionary feats.
					
					 It also ran articles titled "Let us open the decisive phase of national reunification by the concerted efforts of the whole nation" and "We will turn out in the struggle for independence, democracy and peaceful reunification!"
					
					 The articles called upon all Koreans in the north and the south and overseas to defend the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, meet the blatant challenge of the anti-reunification forces by dint of the national unity and push ahead with the grand nationwide advance for reunification under the banner of "By our nation itself" full of confidence in victory and optimism and thus open up a new phase of national reunification this significant year.

articles.title: Rubricados convenio y protocolo entre Corea y Gabon
articles.content:
Rubricados convenio y protocolo entre Corea y Gabon
						
Pyongyang, 31 de marzo (ATCC) -- Quedaron firmados el dia 30 en Libreville el convenio sobre la cooperacion cultural entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Gabonesa y el protocolo sobre la cooperacion entre el Ministerio de las Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC y el Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores, Cooperacion Internacional y Francofono de la RG.
					En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Kim Yong Nam, el ministro de Salud Publica, Choe Chang Sik, el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior, Ri Myong San, el embajador coreano acreditado en Gabon, Ri Myong Chol, y por la gabonesa, el presidente Ali Bongo Ondimba, el premier Paul Biyoghe Mba, el ministro de Asuntos Exteriores, Cooperacion Internacional y Francofono Paul Toungui, el ministro de Salud Publica, Asuntos Publicos y Familias Alphonsine Mbie Nna, el ministro de Economia, Comercio Exterior, Industria y Turismo Magloire Ngambia, el embajador gabones en la RPDC Emmanuel Allo.
					
					Kim Hyong Jun y Paul Toungui suscribieron documentos.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de agradecimiento a presidente gabones
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de agradecimiento a presidente gabones
  Pyongyang, 31 de marzo (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 31 un mensaje de agradecimiento al presidente de la Republica Gabonesa, Ali Bongo Ondimba partiendo de este pais africano tras realizar una visita oficial y de amistad a este.
					  El remitente expresa su profundo agradecimiento al presidente, el gobierno y el pueblo de Gabon por haberles calurosa bienvenida y cordial hospitalidad.
					
					 Subraya que esta vez, en varias conversaciones y charlas se intercambiaron las sinceras opiniones sobre el problema de fortalecer continua y activamente las relaciones bilaterales y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.
					
					  Asevera que esta muy alegre de que esta visita efectuada bajo la profunda atencion del presidente y el gobierno de Gabon haya servido de un importante motivo para profundizar la comprension y fraternidad mutuas e impulsar el desarrollo de las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					   Destaca que constato directamente los magnificos exitos que logra el pueblo gabones en la labor para obtener la prosperidad del pais y quedo muy emocionado por el respecto. 
					
					Formula sinceros votos por el nuevo progreso y bienestar del amistoso pueblo gabones y la salud del remitente y los mayores exitos en su labor.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam parte de Libreville
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam parte de Libreville
 Pyongyang, 31 de marzo (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, partio el dia 31 de Libreville tras realizar una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica Gabonesa.
					 Le acompanan el ministro de Salud Publica Choe Chang Sik, el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Myong San y otros.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam y su comitiva fueron despedidos por el premier de Gabon, Paul Biyoghe Mba, el ministro de Asuntos Exteriores, Cooperacion Internacional y Francofono, Paul Toungui, la ministra de Defensa, Angelique Ngoma, el ministro del Interior, Seguridad Publica, Emigracion y Descentralizacion, Jean Francois Ndongou, el embajador gabones en Corea, Emmanuel Allo, y otros interesados, asi como el embajador coreano en este pais africano Ri Myong Chol.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela atrocidades bacteriologicas de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela atrocidades bacteriologicas de EE.UU. 
Pyongyang, 31 de marzo (ATCC) -- En estos dias, los periodicos y las radios de varios paises informan en gran medida el hecho de que fueron descubiertos nuevos datos sobre las barbaridades de guerra bacteriologica de los imperialistas norteamericanos perpetradas en la guerra coreana (1950-1953).
					  Esos datos revelan que en septiembre de 1951 el presidente de la Junta de los Jefes de Estado Mayor de Estados Unidos ordeno "empezar sobre el terreno la prueba de gran tamano para analizar la eficiencia del organismo patogeno determinado en el estado de combate".
					
					  Esto deviene el testimonio historico que acusa ante la faz mundial la crueldad y barbaridad de los imperialistas yanquis.
					
					  Asi senala el periodico Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual del dia 31 y continua:
					
					  En la guerra coreana los imperialistas yanquis perpetraron indiscriminadamente la guerra bacteriologica contra los habitantes pacificos de Corea definiendola como uno de los principales medios de guerra.
					
					  Las atrocidades de los yanquis, que desarrollaron y usaron sin vacilacion las armas bacteriologicas para matar mucho mas a los habitantes inocentes en la guerra coreana, devienen el crimen imperdonable que pueden perpetrar solo los barbaros asesinos norteamericanos.
					
					  EE.UU., que perpetra tales crimenes y actos de violacion a los derechos humanos, burla la conciencia humana hablando del "humanitarismo" y el "respeto a los DDHH".
					
					  Hace unos dias, EE.UU. hizo publico el "informe de DDHH por unidad de los paises para 2009" calificando arbitrariamente sobre la "situacion de DDHH" de otros paises.
					
					  E incluso, EE.UU. actua en la escena de la ONU como "juez internacional" hablando tanto de la "defensa de los derechos humanos".
					
					  Nunca seran aceptadas por nadie las maniobras taimadas de EE.UU., caudillo de la violacion a los DDHH, que se autodenomina el "defensor de los derechos humanos".
					
					  EE.UU. debe reconocer con sinceridad sus atrocidades de la guerra bacteriologica cometidas contra el pueblo coreano durante la guerra coreana y purgar sus crimenes.
